page.title: 08CHANGING TIMES
page.content: AN ACCOUNT BY A PUPIL AT ST.PAUL'S This evening on July 1st I interviewed my father. He went to Highwood Preparatory School which was at the end of Lawrence Gardens near our house. The school is now a house called Greenfields. I asked him about the shops in Mill Hill Broadway and he said most of the green grocers are still here, but most of the old shops are banks or building societies. He said W.H.Smiths was still there when he was young and also Woolworths. He said prices have gone up a lot over the years. I asked if there was anything he liked about Mill Hill when he was younger that he would like to be here now, but he could not think of anything. To end with he said there was a lot more traffic now.
